testsuite.name: iOS SDK Full Regression test Suite For Mraid Ad's
testsuite.details: iOS SDK Full Regression test Suite For Mraid Ad's

testcase.name: Headers
testcase.summary: Check Vungle specific headers in all API calls from SDK
testcase.preconditions:
Check Vungle specific headers in all API calls

  • /new API call
  • /config API call
  • /requestAd API call
  • /requestStreamingAd API call
  • /reportAd API call
  • /sessionStart API call
  • /endSession API call

step.actions:
1. Start Test app
  2. Check API call header with CharlesProxy
step.expectedresults:
"X-VUNGLE-TIMEZONE"
"X-VUNGLE-LANGUAGE"
"X-VUNGLE-BUNDLE-ID"
"User-Agent"


should be included in HTTP header with valid data

testcase.name: ifa
testcase.summary: Check if "ifa" param is included in all API call from SDK
testcase.preconditions:
Check if "ifa" param is included in all API calls

  • /new API call
  • /config API call
  • /requestAd API call
  • /requestStreamingAd API call
  • /reportAd API call
  • /startSession API call
  • /endSession API call

step.actions:
1. Start Test app
  2. Check API call header with CharlesProxy
step.expectedresults: "ifa" is included with valid data

testcase.name: Request and Response and its format- /new API Call
testcase.summary: During SDK initialization process, check /new API call is sent
testcase.preconditions: Check /new API call is sent with correct data only one time after installing app.

step.actions:
1. Install new Test App (delete previous installed Test Apps)
  2. Start the SDK
  3. Check API call Request and Response with CharlesProxy
step.expectedresults:
• /new API is sent only one time after app install
  • This API call should be GET
  • request has the correct data
  • response has the correct data (HTTP 20X)

testcase.name: Request and Response and its format -/config API Call
testcase.summary: During SDK initialization process, check /config API call is sent.
testcase.preconditions: Check /config API call is sent with correct data every time an app is launched, after periodic update interval, and upon returning from the background

step.actions:
1. Start Test app
  2. Check API call header with CharlesProxy
step.expectedresults:
• /config API is sent
  • This API call should be POST
  • request has the correct data
  • response has the correct data

testcase.name: Request and Response and its format-/requestStreamingAd API Call
testcase.summary: Verify that SDK request streaming Ad when appropriate.
testcase.preconditions: When playing an Ad, the SDK should attempt to request a Streaming (Exchange) ad if the user is under WiFi and the optIn flag from config is set to true.

step.actions:
1. Start QA TestApp
  2. Wait to get a pre-cached ad.
  3. Verify that optIn is true and that the test device/simulator is on WiFi
  4. Attempt to play an Ad.

testcase.name: Request and Response and its format- /sessionEnd API Call
testcase.summary: When an app is terminated, or is backgrounded check /sessionEnd API call is sent
testcase.preconditions: Check /sessionEnd API call is sent with correct data every time an app is terminated, or is backgrounded

step.actions:
1. Start Test app
  2. And, terminate an app, or send it to background
    1. Check API call Request and Response with CharlesProxy
step.expectedresults:
• /sessionEnd API is sent
  • This API call should be POST
  • request has the correct data
  • response has the correct data

testcase.name: Invalid Response - Malformed JSON
testcase.summary: When response from API calls are malformed, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when it gets malformed response from "config" API call

step.actions:
1.     Prepare "malformed" response (invalid JSON)
  2.     Start Test app
  3.     Map "config" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return malformed response
  4.     Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash and should keep retrying to get a valid config. The SDK should be able to play Ads.

testcase.name: Invalid Response for requestAd - Malformed contains null for every value in the JSON object.
testcase.summary: When response from API calls are malformed, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Verify SDK behavior when it gets a JSON response from requestAd endpoint that contains null for every value in the JSON object.

step.actions:
1. Prepare "malformed" response
  2. Start Test app
  3. Map "requestAd" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return a /requestAd response that contains null for every value.
  4. Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: The SDK should keep retrying requesting Ads until a valid request is retrieved

testcase.name: Invalid Response - Malformed JSON response from requestAd endpoint that contains empty string
testcase.summary: When response from API calls are malformed, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Verify SDK behavior when it gets a JSON response from requestAd endpoint that contains empty string ("") for every value in the JSON object.

step.actions:
1. Prepare an JSON response
  2. Map /requestStreamingAd API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return a response with empty string in all of it's values (take a /requestAd response and set empty string "" for all the values).
  3. Start Test App
  4. Allow the test App to request an Ad
step.expectedresults: The SDK should play a cached Ad (for any adTypes: local, MRAID, third party)

testcase.name: Invalid Response from "config" API call includes Null values
testcase.summary: When response from API calls includes Null values in it, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when the response from "config" API call includes Null values

step.actions:
1. Prepare response with null values
  2. Start Test app
  3. Map "config" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return response with Null values
  4. Check the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults: SDK should not crash and should keep retrying to get a valid config. The SDK should be able to play Ads.

testcase.name: Invalid Response from "requestAd" API call includes Null values
testcase.summary: When response from API calls includes Null values in it, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Check if SDK behaves accordingly when the response from "requestAd" API call includes Null values

testcase.name: Config Behavior-Manipulate "updateDelay" value in response
testcase.summary: Based on Config Response, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Manipulate "updateDelay" value in response and see if SDK works as expected

step.actions:
1. Prepare "config" response with manipulated "updateDelay" value
  2. Start Test app
  3. Map "config" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
  4. Check if the SDK behaves as expected
step.expectedresults:
• This parameter determines when to send the next config request
  • The parameter expects time in seconds
  • You can change the value to 5 seconds for example. The SDK must update the config every 5 seconds. You can easily see that in CharlesProxy

testcase.name: Config Behavior-Manipulate "optIn" value in response
testcase.summary: Based on Config Response, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Manipulate "optIn" value in response and see if SDK works as expected

step.actions:
1. Prepare "config" response with manipulated "optIn" value
  2. Start Test app
  3. Map "config" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
  4. Check if the SDK behaves as expected
step.expectedresults:
• If set to false, no streaming Ads should be played, only cached Ad should get display.
  • Could be vungle_local or vungle_mraid depending on type
  • To test that, set it to false, play a video. The SDK only plays the cached Ad and requestStreamingAd must not be sent. You can tell if that is the case using CharlesProxy

testcase.name: Config Behavior-Manipulate "connection" value in response
testcase.summary: Based on Config Response, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Manipulate "connection" value in response and see if SDK works as expected

step.actions: Manipulate "connection" value in response and see if SDK works as expected
step.expectedresults:
• Default connection is wifi, it could be data as well
  • If wifi is selected, the SDK does not try to stream .

testcase.name: Ad Expiry
testcase.summary: The SDK should follow the cached ad expiry date.
testcase.preconditions: Check how the SDK behave when the cached ad is expired.

step.actions:
1. Prepare "requestAd" response with manipulated "expiry" value to make an ad expire soon
  2. Start Test app
  3. Map "requestAd" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
  4. Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
step.expectedresults:
• The SDK should not display the expired ad.
  • The SDK should send new "requestAd"

testcase.name: Low Storage Space
testcase.summary: The SDK should behave as expected,when a device doesn't have enough space to caching an ad assets
testcase.preconditions: Check how the SDK behave when a device doesn't have enough disk space to cache an ad assets.

step.actions:
1. Prepare a device with almost full in disk space
  2. Start Test app
  3. Make sure if an ad asset can't be downloaded since the device doesn't have enough space
  4. Check if the SDK behaves
step.expectedresults:
• The SDK should give up downloading the ad asset.
  • The SDK should try to send "requestAd" again.

testcase.name: Broken asset- when "MP4" assets are broken
testcase.summary: The SDK should behave as expected, when downloaded assets are broken.
testcase.preconditions: Check how the SDK should try to send "requestAd" again, when "MP4" assets are broken.

step.actions:
1. Prepare broken asset (example, make simple text file ("brokenAsset.txt"), and rename it as "brokenAsset.mp4", and upload to local server.
  2. Prepare "requestAd" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asset you prepared in #1.
  3. Start Test app
  4. Map "requestAd" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
  5. Check if the SDK behaves accordingly

Test the same thing for "requestStreamingAd" case

Test the same thing for MRAID case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

  2. Play an ad and go to end card
  3. Tap on "download" button

Test the same thing for "requestStreamingAd" case

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks
testcase.summary: Play an ad successfully
testcase.preconditions: The user should view the callback logs before an after a successful ad play to see how callback data will be shown in the table view.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`.
  3. Wait for label `Got an Ad` to be displayed.
  4. Tap `Callbacks` button - it's the fifth button on the tab bar.
  5. Verify: The Callback log shows one (1) entry - the entry should be for the callback `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:`.
  6. Tap `Vungle` to go back to the main view. Tap `Play Ad`. Watch ad and post roll (if any). Tap `Close` button to return to main view.
  7. Tap `Callbacks` button - Verify: There should be five (5) entries. These should be listed in descending order by date/time.
  8. Tap `Descending` to resort the list in date order (when tapped, the button text should change to `Ascending` and the list should be ordered to reflect that.
  9. Verify: While the button text is `Ascending`, the five entries are (in order):
    1. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == YES
    2. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == NO
    3. `vungleSDKWillShowAd`
    4. `vungleSDKWillCloseAdWithViewInfo:` with a view info dictionary
    5. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == YES
  10. When the list is shown in `Ascending` order, the repeating pattern you should be able to see with each ad play is:
    1. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == YES
    2. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == NO
    3. `vungleSDKWillShowAd`
    4. `vungleSDKWillCloseAdWithViewInfo:` with a view info dictionary
step.expectedresults:
• Callback Log shows one (1) entry when SDK receives ad - step 5.
  • After ad play, the callback log table should have five (5) entries - step 7.
  • When button text shows ascending, order of callback table entries should match those detailed in step 9.
  • When button text shows descending, order of callback table entries should match those detailed in step 10.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks-added to empty table view
testcase.summary: See callback added to empty table view
testcase.preconditions: The user should start Vungle and switch to the callback logs table view to see the list automatically update when a callback is received.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`.
  3. Immediately tap the `Callbacks` button. The view should have NO log entries (if this is a fresh app install - if you've been testing for some time, you may have log entries). Verify that the button in top left has the text `Descending `.
  4. Verify: A new entry appears at the top of the list when a new ad is ready for viewing. The entry should be `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` and the `isAdPlayable` should be YES.
  5. Tap `Vungle` to return to the main view. Continue testing as normal.
step.expectedresults: • Verify that a new entry is added to the callback logs table when a callback is received - step 4.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks-added to the beginning and the end of callback list in table view
testcase.summary: See callback added to the beginning and the end of callback list in table view
testcase.preconditions: After a few successful ad plays, the user should follow the steps below to see a callback added to the beginning of the callback list.  The user should continue with the steps to see the callback added to the end of the callback list in the table view.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`, proceed with testing as normal. Try and run through at least 3 ads.
  3. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows. Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 12 rows, plus one more for the next ad.
  4. Tap `options`, and then tap `Clear Cache`. In the alert, tap `YES` to confirm that the cache is cleared.
  5. Tap `Vungle` and tap `Play Ad` - this is needed to request a new ad.
  6. Tap `Callbacks`, verify the button text in the top left is `Descending`. Verify: When the app receives a new ad, a new row should appear at the top of the list. The entry should be `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` and the `isAdPlayable` should be YES.
  7. Tap `options`, and then tap `Clear Cache`. In the alert, tap `YES` to confirm that the cache is cleared.
  8. Tap `Vungle` and tap `Play Ad` - this is needed to request a new ad.
  9. Tap `Callbacks`, verify the button text in the top left is `Ascending`.
  10. Scroll to the bottom of the list.
  11. Verify: When the app receives a new ad, a new row should appear at the bottom of the list (you may need to scroll up to view it). The entry should be `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` and the `isAdPlayable` should be YES.
  12. If necessary, continue testing as normal.
step.expectedresults:
• When the list is shown in `Descending` order (by timestamp), new callbacks should be added to the top of the list - step 6.
  • When the list is shown in 'Ascending' order (by timestamp), new callbacks should be added to the bottom of the list - step 11.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks- list can be deleted
testcase.summary: Verify that callback list can be deleted
testcase.preconditions: After a few successful ad plays, the user should be able to review the callback list and then delete it. After deletion, the user should continue testing and see that the list is updated with new callback information.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`, proceed with testing as normal. Try and run through at least 3 ads.
  3. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows. Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 12 rows, plus one more for the next ad.
  4. Tap the trashcan icon in the top right. In the alert, confirm that you wish to delete the callback log data.
  5. Verify: The callback list is deleted.
  6. Tap `Vungle` and continue testing, try and play at least three ads.
  7. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows (the first should only have three, since we deleted the log before playing the first ad). Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 11 (3 + 4 + 4) rows, plus one more for the next ad.
step.expectedresults: • The callback list can be deleted - step 5.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks-Verify that the callback list can be shared
testcase.summary: Verify that the callback list can be shared (NOTE: This test should be performed on a device.)
testcase.preconditions: After a few successful ad plays, the user should be able to export the callback list and share it using one of the options available to them.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`, proceed with testing as normal. Try and run through at least 3 ads.
  3. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows. Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 12 rows, plus one more for the next ad.
  4. Verify: Tap the share/action button next to the trashcan button in the top right corner. Choose one of the options available (Messages, Notes, Mail) and confirm that the list is copied into the selected option.
  5. Return to the app and continue testing as normal.
step.expectedresults: • Verify that the callback data can be shared using any of the options available in the action list - step 4.

testcase.name: Check Vungle MRAID Ads play normally
testcase.summary: Check all types of ads playback normally
testcase.preconditions: Check "Vungle MRAID ad" playback normally

step.actions:
1. Prepare "AdType = vungle_mraid" response for requestAd
  2. Start Test app
  3. Map "requestAd" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response (prepared in #1)
  4. Make sure the SDK get the correct type of ad you specified
  5. Check playback
step.expectedresults:
• Video should be playback normally til, end
  • An end-card should be displayed correctly
  • Check Mraid specific behavior
  • Icon overlays such as close, cta, mute are displayed without layout issues

testcase.name: Incentivized option

If plugin name and version is correctly entered in options tab of test App, then it should reflect in UserAgent of header in API calls.

eg: "User-Agent" - "Vungle/4.0.9;mopub"

testcase.name: Close button behavior for MRAID video
testcase.summary: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly

step.actions:
1)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",
"CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5",

2)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5",
"CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",

3)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",
"CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999",
step.expectedresults:
1) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value,
which is 5. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.

2) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value,
which is skippable close button; otherwise, it should delay for 5 seconds.

3) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value,
which is 9999 which is skippable close button.. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks
testcase.summary: Play an ad successfully
testcase.preconditions: The user should view the callback logs before an after a successful ad play to see how callback data will be shown in the table view.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`.
  3. Wait for label `Got an Ad` to be displayed.
  4. Tap `Callbacks` button - it's the fifth button on the tab bar.
  5. Verify: The Callback log shows one (1) entry - the entry should be for the callback `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:`.
  6. Tap `Vungle` to go back to the main view. Tap `Play Ad`. Watch ad and post roll (if any). Tap `Close` button to return to main view.
  7. Tap `Callbacks` button - Verify: There should be five (5) entries. These should be listed in descending order by date/time.
  8. Tap `Descending` to resort the list in date order (when tapped, the button text should change to `Ascending` and the list should be ordered to reflect that.
  9. Verify: While the button text is `Ascending`, the five entries are (in order):
    1. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == YES
    2. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == NO
    3. `vungleSDKWillShowAd`
    4. `vungleSDKWillCloseAdWithViewInfo:` with a view info dictionary
    5. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == YES
  10. When the list is shown in `Ascending` order, the repeating pattern you should be able to see with each ad play is:
    1. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == YES
    2. `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` with `isAdPlayable` == NO
    3. `vungleSDKWillShowAd`
    4. `vungleSDKWillCloseAdWithViewInfo:` with a view info dictionary
step.expectedresults:
• Callback Log shows one (1) entry when SDK receives ad - step 5.
  • After ad play, the callback log table should have five (5) entries - step 7.
  • When button text shows ascending, order of callback table entries should match those detailed in step 9.
  • When button text shows descending, order of callback table entries should match those detailed in step 10.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks-added to empty table view
testcase.summary: See callback added to empty table view
testcase.preconditions: The user should start Vungle and switch to the callback logs table view to see the list automatically update when a callback is received.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`.
  3. Immediately tap the `Callbacks` button. The view should have NO log entries (if this is a fresh app install - if you've been testing for some time, you may have log entries). Verify that the button in top left has the text `Descending `.
  4. Verify: A new entry appears at the top of the list when a new ad is ready for viewing. The entry should be `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` and the `isAdPlayable` should be YES.
  5. Tap `Vungle` to return to the main view. Continue testing as normal.
step.expectedresults: • Verify that a new entry is added to the callback logs table when a callback is received - step 4.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks-added to the beginning and the end of callback list in table view
testcase.summary: See callback added to the beginning and the end of callback list in table view
testcase.preconditions: After a few successful ad plays, the user should follow the steps below to see a callback added to the beginning of the callback list.  The user should continue with the steps to see the callback added to the end of the callback list in the table view.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`, proceed with testing as normal. Try and run through at least 3 ads.
  3. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows. Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 12 rows, plus one more for the next ad.
  4. Tap `options`, and then tap `Clear Cache`. In the alert, tap `YES` to confirm that the cache is cleared.
  5. Tap `Vungle` and tap `Play Ad` - this is needed to request a new ad.
  6. Tap `Callbacks`, verify the button text in the top left is `Descending`. Verify: When the app receives a new ad, a new row should appear at the top of the list. The entry should be `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` and the `isAdPlayable` should be YES.
  7. Tap `options`, and then tap `Clear Cache`. In the alert, tap `YES` to confirm that the cache is cleared.
  8. Tap `Vungle` and tap `Play Ad` - this is needed to request a new ad.
  9. Tap `Callbacks`, verify the button text in the top left is `Ascending`.
  10. Scroll to the bottom of the list.
  11. Verify: When the app receives a new ad, a new row should appear at the bottom of the list (you may need to scroll up to view it). The entry should be `vungleSDKAdPlayableChanged:` and the `isAdPlayable` should be YES.
  12. If necessary, continue testing as normal.
step.expectedresults:
• When the list is shown in `Descending` order (by timestamp), new callbacks should be added to the top of the list - step 6.
  • When the list is shown in 'Ascending' order (by timestamp), new callbacks should be added to the bottom of the list - step 11.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks- list can be deleted
testcase.summary: Verify that callback list can be deleted
testcase.preconditions: After a few successful ad plays, the user should be able to review the callback list and then delete it. After deletion, the user should continue testing and see that the list is updated with new callback information.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`, proceed with testing as normal. Try and run through at least 3 ads.
  3. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows. Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 12 rows, plus one more for the next ad.
  4. Tap the trashcan icon in the top right. In the alert, confirm that you wish to delete the callback log data.
  5. Verify: The callback list is deleted.
  6. Tap `Vungle` and continue testing, try and play at least three ads.
  7. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows (the first should only have three, since we deleted the log before playing the first ad). Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 11 (3 + 4 + 4) rows, plus one more for the next ad.
step.expectedresults: • The callback list can be deleted - step 5.

testcase.name: SDK Callbacks-Verify that the callback list can be shared
testcase.summary: Verify that the callback list can be shared (NOTE: This test should be performed on a device.)
testcase.preconditions: After a few successful ad plays, the user should be able to export the callback list and share it using one of the options available to them.

step.actions:
1. Launch App
  2. Tap `Start Vungle`, proceed with testing as normal. Try and run through at least 3 ads.
  3. Tap `Callbacks` - for each ad displayed, there should be four rows. Plus one extra for the ad that should be queued up for playback. So, if three ads played, there should be 12 rows, plus one more for the next ad.
  4. Verify: Tap the share/action button next to the trashcan button in the top right corner. Choose one of the options available (Messages, Notes, Mail) and confirm that the list is copied into the selected option.
  5. Return to the app and continue testing as normal.
step.expectedresults: • Verify that the callback data can be shared using any of the options available in the action list - step 4.

testcase.name: Controlling Playback Behavior-Check if the SDK follow the value "delay" parameter
testcase.summary: Playback should follow the values in response from "requestAd" API call
testcase.preconditions: Check if the SDK follow the value "delay" parameter in response from "requestAd" API call

step.actions:
1. Prepare "requestAd" response with setting "delay" value to specific time in second
  2. Start Test app
  3. Map "requestAd" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
  4. Init SDK and play an ad and finish it, then close it
  5. Try to play another ad
step.expectedresults:
• Second ad should not be played during the time you specified in "delay"
  • Delay parameters should not affect requestStreamingAd and therefore it is by design for the delay parameter to be ignored when set in requestStreamingAd. When set in requestAd it should work for both Streaming and Cached ads. (need clear description)
  • Delay parameter only applicable for Legacy Ad (Ad type:- vungle_local)

testcase.preconditions: An app shouldn't crash while in the background

• Start Test app

  • Send app to the background for 5 minutes
  • Play video and send to background. While playing the video, swipe down notifications, video should pause. Swipe back notifications, the video should now resume.
  • Android: When the device's lock screen is set to none(Settings->Security->Screen lock none on Android devices), play video, off/lock the device, on/unlock the device again, the video should resume after the device is unlocked
step.expectedresults: The App shouldn't crash at any point
